Text:
Funny, how followers of one religion like to criticize the "holy" books of another religion. 

How about criticizing your own books ?

Or Shakespeare's Hamlet?
@ tuvokk... how witty of you... could you also tell us in whose murky and conspirative service  "moman73" is supposed to stand? Please enlighten us... :-) :-) :-)

@rasputinho are you saying that moman is a "member of the christian community"? if that is the case then I have to apologize because then he would indeed criticize his own "holy" book.
But then again, when you say "(he) should be carefull what he says", sounds like you are threatening him? Why do you do that? Let him believe whatever nonsense he wants to believe. No need to threaten him.

Anyone who've read the books in question would know that the Koran is basically a carbon copy of the Bible, which again is the Torah, with some inconsistent ramblings added on to the end.

Islam, Christianity and Judaism are all just very, very slight variations over the same theme and all equally inconsistent and moronic.
